Node.definition: = referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= the state of being apart from significant others

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which deities, humans, or towns have a high status or authority

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= state in which deities, humans, or towns have a high status or authority

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a woman of rank
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= a class of people who are enlisted compulsorily to do work for others

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
jaw, cheek

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= action by which a group of people leave their country because they are forced to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= a place where humans or animals can find rest after a time of activity
= action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them
= a point of time during the middle or climax of an event
= a state in which humans experience extreme anxiety, ◄ as a result of difficult circumstances, as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
= process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
literally: head; hence: = the person in leadership of a group of people, or, by extension, the most important object among a set of objects
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities inflict sorrow and suffering on (other) humans
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a person or group that has been forcibly carried off to prison, into slavery, or resettlement
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event stops taking place
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

= wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= something that is the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of its quality or value
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to fall into the hand(s) of someone; hence: = process by which humans or nations fall under someone else's authority and control
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness
= state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which objects are considered impure because of their association with evil practices
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= action by which humans treat other humans as unworthy of respect

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
literally: to move back; hence: = process by which humans move backwards without turning around

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion

= something that causes humans, animals, or objects to be regarded by the law as having been contaminated, as a result of which anything that touches them may become contaminated as well; ► humans, animals, and objects that are unclean cannot participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
literally: to go down; hence: = process by which humans lose their power or social status

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to stretch out (one's) hands (in order to take something); hence: = action by which humans take the possessions of other humans against their will
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

literally: to bring back (one's) self; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a sense of well being to (other) humans, which may extend from feeling refreshed after a good meal to feeling contented because of a major change in one's life situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which a type of behavior is considered unworthy of respect

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
literally: wound; hence: = state in which humans experience a deep sense of grief, ◄ as if wounded in spirit
literally: wound; hence: = state in which humans experience a deep sense of grief, ◄ as if wounded in spirit
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities inflict sorrow and suffering on (other) humans
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: kindling of anger; hence: = process by which the anger (אַף) of deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
read ירד (ירד)
= causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
literally: to cause (someone) to move back; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to stop advancing and move backwards instead

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= state in which someone feels physically weak; ◄ as if one were menstruating

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= process by which cord like objected are twined together
literally: to go up; hence: = process by which an object appears on top of or over another one
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride
literally: to cause to stumble; hence: = causative process by which a deity causes a condition to become gradually less intensive
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= powerful person
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= a formal gathering of humans or deities for a particular purpose
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

= basin ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat (יֶקֶב) ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which tears flow in copious amounts from the eyes of humans ◄ as a result of deep sorrow

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

literally: to bring back (one's) self; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a sense of well being to (other) humans, which may extend from feeling refreshed after a good meal to feeling contented because of a major change in one's life situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to become powerful|to grow mighty|to prevail
Node.definition: = process by which humans gain strength, power, and authority, which enables them to do things that others are unable to accomplish
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which objects are considered impure because of their association with evil practices
= the area separating two or mores locations
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man|literally: wound; hence: = state in which humans experience a deep sense of grief, ◄ as if wounded in spirit
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= state in which people, animals or objects have been forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

literally: to bring back (one's) self; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a sense of well being to (other) humans, which may extend from feeling refreshed after a good meal to feeling contented because of a major change in one's life situation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape|= a state in which humans experience extreme anxiety, ◄ as a result of difficult circumstances, as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

Node.gloss: to be agitated|to be in turmoil|to be disturbed
Node.definition: = state in which parts of one's body function in an abnormal way ◄ as if agitated or fermenting; ≈ associated with deep sorrow
= process by which events take on a different nature
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= referent to the location outside of an object
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a condition that leads to death, like a deadly disease or a wave of violence
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally, weak in one's heart; hence: = state in which someone feels unable to think or act properly ◄ as a result of hardship in one's own or someone else's life
